New Records: India are now 8-0 against Pakistan in World Cups
Rohit Sharma has made 217 runs in 147 balls over his last two trips to the crease
Rohit Sharma is already the record holder for most World Cup centuries
Key Match Events: India won by 7 wickets with 117 balls remaining
KL Rahul played out an over to allow Shreyas Iyer to reach his fifty
Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah triggered a Pakistan collapse of 8 for 36
Rohit Sharma raised a 36-ball fifty against Pakistan
India scored 79 runs in the first 10 overs
Jasprit Bumrah picked up two wickets in two overs
Kuldeep Yadav took crucial wickets with his wrist spin
Babar Azam scored a half-century but was dismissed soon after
Mohammad Rizwan was dismissed by Jasprit Bumrah
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma emphasized the significance of India vs Pakistan matches
Babar Azam and Rohit Sharma went head-to-head as captains for the first time at the ODI World Cup
Shaheen Shah Afridi has picked up a wicket in the first over of an ODI seven times in 29 tries over the last five years
Post-Match Reflections: Fireworks went off in Ahmedabad as India won
The crowd sang verses from Ma Tujhe Salaam
Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad
The stadium was nearly full with a sea of blue
The India vs Pakistan World Cup game was broadcast in the USA on ESPN+
Live ball-by-ball commentary was available in Hindi and Tamil
